Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery slightly ribbed vessel, much of the interior surface has flaked away, the exterior, now also very worn, is covered with a self-slip and very faint traces of a number of lines of black-painted text.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394739) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394739)
